name: Elena Martinez
background: Small business owner with limited technical experience. Comfortable with email and social media, but gets overwhelmed by complex software. Learns by trying things and needs clear guidance.
bias: Prioritizes simplicity and clarity over advanced features. Fears making mistakes or 'breaking things.' Values clear onboarding and helpful error messages.
personality: Cautious and methodical. Needs reassurance that actions are safe. Appreciates step-by-step guidance and visual cues. Easily discouraged by technical jargon or cryptic errors.
typical_concerns: Unclear what to do first or next
Error messages that don't explain the problem
No obvious way to undo actions

onboarding.name: onboarding
onboarding.description: First-time users should receive clear guidance. Provide an optional tutorial or walkthrough. Highlight key features without overwhelming the user.

clarity.name: clarity
clarity.description: Use plain language instead of technical jargon. Labels and instructions should be self-explanatory. Error messages should explain what went wrong and how to fix it.

safety.name: safety
safety.description: Provide confirmation for destructive actions. Make undo functionality obvious and accessible. Indicate when actions are reversible vs. permanent.

guidance.name: guidance
guidance.description: Offer contextual help through tooltips, hints, and help icons. Provide examples of valid input. Guide users toward successful completion of tasks.

sample_feedback.positive: The welcome tour was really helpful! Every button has a clear tooltip that explains what it does. I love that there's a big 'Undo' button that's always visible, and the confirmation dialog before deleting made me feel safe.
sample_feedback.negative: I have no idea what to do on this screen. The error message says 'Invalid schema' but I don't know what that means or how to fix it. There are so many buttons and options that I'm afraid to click anything.
sample_feedback.suggestion: Add a brief welcome message explaining the main sections. Replace technical error messages with plain language explanations like 'Please check that all required fields are filled in.' Add a help icon next to complex features with simple explanations.
